Articles.Content:
A shockwave cone is something I'd like to do in the future too!

That would be nice, but the effects which are already there are also very good.Feels much more immersive now, when reaching supersonic velocities...
There is almost nothing more satisfying than deorbiting a spaceplane and hearing the sonic boom when you reach the atmosphere. Also a shockwave cone would be cool but I like it how it is right now.
This is one of the best mods now in my opinion because of the muffled option!
Version 2.1 is now available for download here. It has fixes several issues that could cause the sound effects not to be played.

I approve of this.

awesome job dude.

Version 2.1 is now available for download here. It has fixes several issues that could cause the sound effects not to be played.

YES, thankyou! testing now

Thanks for the fix, works every time now. One thing I noticed is that now the distortion effect of rocket engines can be heard inside, sounds a bit lo fi, also the whining, (as opposed to bass rumble) of some jet engines, namely the b9 vtol jet, is un-effected by the mod and is un-muffled when IVA, though this may just be down to the b9 mod; stock turbo jets seem to work properly. But very nice, thanks for the work on this!

Also, just started using the real solar system mod (real sized planets) and was wandering if the mod automatically adjusts the altitude effect scale to the game or if there's a way to manually scale it up for this mod? couldn't see anything in the config.

Thanks pingopete, I'll take a look at it.

As far as planet changes concerned, ASE uses the planet's atmosphere to model things accurately, so it doesn't need tweaked for new or modified planets. It should work with Real Solar System and the new planets in Planet Factory, though I haven't tested it myself. It's also likely that it will work with 0.23, but we'll find out after KerbalCon.
is this going to be OK for .23??? just want to make sure i dont create any problems... thanks.
I didn't try it because they changed the way effects work in some cases, but it's not going to melt down your computer to give it a shot. Probably. I add that disclaimer in case it does.

Oh, aren't you the sly one..... No problem... will be testing it here real soon. Working my way up my list of mods to test and verify.

thanks.
Works great on 0.23!

Works great on 0.23!

Thanks will try it myself after work

Works great on 0.23!

Thanks TomatoSoup! I haven't got a chance to test things yet, pretty busy. Glad to hear it's working in 0.23!
I concur, works great for me as well. No problems found so far...
Great Mod i use it alot
I've done a fresh build of ASE with 0.23, just in case. No changes to how it works. It's available here.

I've done a fresh build of ASE with 0.23, just in case. No changes to how it works. It's available here.

Just trying this now -- very nice.
Any chance of seeing that shockwave cone anytime soon??

I'm not sure about the shockwave cone. It depends on the shape and size of the rocket, and a pre-generated cone would be pretty far from reality in some cases.

See this Ares launch for example:

This is a fantastic mod! I've noticed that sometimes for initial stages, the sound cone doesn't actually form. I am not sure how to predict when it will and when it won't work, because it seems fairly random. When it does run into a problem, it usually fixes itself by the next stage. Also sometimes when going into and coming out of time acceleration, the RCS noises will come back. Are either of these bugs known? If not I'd be glad to try to look more deeply into the problem to see if I can reproduce it regularly.
I've also noticed that sometimes the sound-code/muffling doesn't happen. Occasionally it will kick into action after I've gone to map view and back, but it's not consistent.
Does this work with Deadly Reentry? Awesome Mod By the way. I love it!

Awesome. Here's an advice, to make sound gradually disappear while crossing the Mach cone, instead of a suddenly cut-off.

And... It seems that this plugin has some contradictions with FAR+DRE, for condensation cloud disappear while beyond 1.2 Mach and appear again after crossing a certain height.

Edit: Uhh this seems to only happen in Real Solar System.

Edited January 3, 2014 by Cesrate
Uhh... It seems that the gradient of volume changes hasn't been included. This should be fix...
